intro: Phyllanthus vakinankaratrae, commonly known as the Madagascar spurge, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its small, green, spiny leaves. The plant produces yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, and it is often found in dry, rocky habitats. It has a short stature and is adapted to the arid conditions of its native environment. Due to its unique morphology and restricted distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
